title.narrative: EVIDENCE,RESOURCES,POLICIES,STRATEGIES ON HIV

description.narrative: By 2021, the Government generates evidence, mobilizes resources and has policies and strategies in place in line with global recommendations for HIV, which contributes to Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved, scaled up and equitable use of proven HIV prevention, treatment, care and support interventions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the Government generates evidence, mobilizes resources and has policies and strategies in place in line with global recommendations for HIV

description.narrative: Advocacy by UNICEF together with the National Network of People living with HIV and PEPFAR contributed to parliament's approval of the amended HIV act to allow HIV testing without parental consent for adolescents 15-19 years. New HIV funding from global partners was secured, data from three age and sex disaggregated studies became available to inform the national HIV response on children, and the National Guidelines for the Management of HIV were updated to be aligned with global WHO recommendations. These results were possible through collaborations between UNICEF and USAID, CDC, UNAIDS, the National Medical Research Institute as well as NGOs. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Existence of national household survey based data on HIV disaggregated by age and sex collected within the preceding 5 years

baseline.value: 2011/12 AIDS Indicator Survey (to be updated in early 2017 with THIA 2016)

target.value: 2021:HIV secondary data analysis of DHS and THIS (2019); THIS 2021 (or equivalent)

actual.value: 2019:NACP HIV data handbook provides regularly age/sex disaggregated data for adolescents.

title.narrative: Availability of age and sex disaggregated HIV programmatic data through harmonised M&E systems

baseline.value: Age-disaggregated HIV data for adolescents unavailable (DHIS2, CTC)

target.value: 2021:HIV data for adolescents (10-14, 15-19, 20-24 years) available (DHIS2, CTC)

actual.value: 2019:HIV prevention assessment and cascade analysis completed. Two reports were completed and shared with stakeholders.

title.narrative: Rescurces mobilized for children and AIDS through large funding mechanisims such as the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and malaria and PEPFAR

baseline.value: GFATM grant approved, including 16 mill USD for AGYW (2018), PEPFAR DREAMS approved for USD 100 mill (2018)

target.value: 2021:UNICEF in PEPFAR and GFATM planning and programme review processes, UNICEF on national AGYW steering committee, Reports on implementation progress and funding levels through national coordination mech

actual.value: 2019:Budget brief; Govt budget increased from 52 million USD in 2017 to 55 million USD in 2018. Budget expenditure figures for 2019 not yet available.

title.narrative: National HIV Strategic plan/guidance for care and treatment that are aligned to Global targets and the most recent WHO recommendations for care and treatment of children , adolescents and pregnant/breast feeding women

baseline.value: WHO ART guidelines introduced in 2017; HSHSP IV launched 2017; National Service Delivery Model developed 2017

target.value: 2021:National HIV Treatment guidelines, including service delivery model for children and adolescents implemented; Mid term review of HSHSP IV; Updated ART guidelines; Age of conscent for HIV lowered

actual.value: 2019:ART guidelines are updated. Draft implementation research report is available.
